linearState.title: Share test plan generation prompt/setup with @U09P6RVHE7P
linearState.description:
PR #2224: Share test plan generation prompt and setup
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2224](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2224)
Status: Open (in review)

Summary of changes:

* Added comprehensive documentation for test plan generation to share with @U09P6RVHE7P
* New docs:
  * docs/test-plan-generation-setup.md (full technical documentation and integration guide)
  * TEST_PLAN_GENERATION_SUMMARY.md (quick reference)
  * SHARE_WITH_RECIPIENT.md (shareable message and instructions)
  * LINEAR_ISSUE_SUMMARY.md (summary/status for this issue)
* References and existing core files:
  * .github/prompts/test-plan-prompt.md (main prompt)
  * .github/workflows/generate-test-plan.yaml (CI workflow)
  * js-services/scripts/generate_pr_spec.ts (PR context/spec generator)
  * docs/acceptance-testing-action-spec.md (acceptance testing integration)

Notes:

* This PR documents the prompt and setup for test plan generation and prepares materials for the intended recipient to integrate into their agent workflows.

linearState.title: Update Responses API integration to support ZDR (copy)
linearState.description:
Tracking additional ZDR compatibility updates.

PR #2229 (open): [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2229](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2229)
Title: zdr fix

Key changes in PR #2229:

* Include reasoning.encrypted_content in Responses API call (include: \["reasoning.encrypted_content"\]) for ZDR compatibility.
* Update \_process_response and \_agent_think to return reasoning_items and propagate them across turns.
* Set store=False and rely on encrypted reasoning items to preserve context with ZDR enabled.
* In stream_advanced_search_answer, prepend prior reasoning_items to subsequent requests to maintain multi‑turn reasoning under ZDR.
* Adjust function signatures and error paths to handle reasoning_items consistently.

Status: Open (in review)

Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2251](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2251)
Status: Open (in review)

Key changes in this PR:

* Corrected import block ordering in src/mcp/api/tool_executor.py to satisfy ruff/isort rules (grouped mcp imports separately from src imports)
* No functional changes; supports the ongoing connector_installations migration (removal of CONNECTOR_GONG and updated table references already present in this PR)

linearState.title: Base: Update Responses API integration to support ZDR
linearState.description:
Problem:

* We want to enable ZDR on our OpenAI organization
* Enabling ZDR may break the OpenAI Responses API, as `store` will no longer be respected
* To continue using the Responses API, we must update our strategy to utilize`reasoning.encrypted_content`

linearState.title: Add yarn checkpoint support for exponent-evals
linearState.description:
Improve realness of eval capture for Slack messages and Linear context.

PR #2255: Merged (2025-12-03)
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2255](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2255)
Author: cursor\[bot\]

Key changes in PR #2255:

* Slack capture:
  * parseSlackLink returns channelId, messageTs, and optional parentThreadTs (supports reply URLs)
  * Added isHumanMessage; filter human-only messages up to the linked timestamp
  * fetchSlackThread uses parentThreadTs, formats sections with headers, fetches user display names
  * Returns artifactTimestamp and richer metadata (messageCount, priorMessageCount, newMessageCount, participants)
  * SlackMessage updated with bot_id, subtype, thread_ts
* Linear issues:
  * Fetch first 20 (was 50) with optional createdAt <= before filter
  * Use artifactTimestamp (from Slack/PR/meeting) to filter
  * Conditional GraphQL variables and improved error handling
* Controller:
  * Compute artifactTimestamp across Slack/GitHub/Meeting flows and pass to Linear fetch
* Frontend:
  * Helper text updated to say 20 most recent issues instead of 50

This PR completes the tracked work; marking the issue as done.

linearState.title: Verify `slackbot_setup_complete` Event Firing
linearState.description:
Ensure that the `slackbot_setup_complete` event is firing correctly. Confirm that the only entry point is `integration_alert_modal_setup_clicked` with `integration_type` = 'Slack'.

* Observation (2025-12-02T22:42:51Z, Sam Smith): In some sessions where this event fired, the user was not on the "set up slack" page; possible spurious firing.
